meanings.definition: To stamp or impress a design or inscription into a surface.
meanings.sent1: The artist used a special tool to incuse the pattern onto the metal.
meanings.sent2: Craftsmen often incuse their initials on handmade items.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to incuse its tiny paw prints on the wet cement.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to incuse themselves into his memory, never to be forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The hammer's force incused the symbol deeply into the soft clay.

meanings.definition: A design or inscription that is stamped or impressed into a surface.
meanings.sent1: The ancient coin had an intricate incuse on one side.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler admired the delicate incuse on the silver bracelet.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a mysterious incuse on the suspect's jacket.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight cast a shadow that resembled an incuse on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map had a hidden incuse that revealed the secret location.
